data.body:
This avoids degrading performance over time as well as a possible (albeit unlikely) OutOfMemoryException.

Fixes #12108.

data.title: TS laser turret preview shows random voxel instead of turret
data.body:
Before placing them down, the preview often shows some other randomly chosen voxel. Once placed down, everything is fine.

I assume this affects voxel turrets in general.

data.title: OutOfMemoryException (external mod)

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
After letting a huge (estimated 200+) amount of actors fire at an empty cell for a while, I stopped them, let them fire again for a while, same for a third time, then selected all units of a specific type (only about 6 of them) and then ordered them to shoot at an empty cell again, which is when the OOM triggered.

It should be noted that after every time I let all 200+ actors fire for a while and then ordered them to stop, ms/Tick did not recover entirely, so the 'idle' tick load was building up over time. For comparison, before the 3rd all-unit firing phase, it was only ~15ms/tick, before the first shooting at that empty cell it was single-digit (don't remember the excact value).

based on bleed from Sept. 18th, right after #12014 was merged.

[exception.log](https://gist.github.com/reaperrr/a15daf3d23ba210b931d65fdd18c556f)
[perf.log](https://gist.github.com/reaperrr/f796279a71e0386fdc5e1ed946679153)

No custom warheads were used. Custom projectile code was used, I'll see if I can repro the OOME with bleed's projectiles and/or a specific projectile type.

custom code can be found here, if necessary: 
https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/mods-mw-code

data.title: Fix integer overflows in Wangle.ArcTan.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Fixes #10549.
Fixes #12101.

It turns out that specific `WVec` values would overflow `1024 * ay - ax * TanTable[i]` and give a value _exactly_ equal to `int.MinValue`.  This would then trigger the seemingly impossible "Negating the minimum value of a twos complement number is invalid" exception.

This fixes the problem by using a long for the intermediate value to avoid the overflow for realistic input values.

Simple repro case: add `Console.WriteLine("{0}", new WVec(-39936,72106,0).Yaw);` somewhere in the code.

data.title: [RA] AA Missile Sub + Tweak

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Remade AA weaponry off the proposed at #12040

Overall it mostly behaves as if the projectile:bullet AA was cut down to range 6c0 - meaning it's mostly effective vs stationary air targets and performs poorly vs moving targets. 
- At close range 1 unit has a high probability of killing an idle Hind with 1 burst, low probability vs Longbow. At max range there's a lower probability of killing an idle Hind with 1 burst. 
- In a wolf pack Missile Subs does pretty well against idling groups of YAKs/MiGs albeit with unpredictable damage results.

Quoting comments https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/86ad7576cefa51e7fcb1042af546b703bed2b002

This commit brings with it the altered Speed + Angle proposed in the predecessing balance PR #12040 for the primary armament. Originally it was altered to address visually the AA capability of the projectile:bullet but it also had the side effect of being more visually pleasing compared to the very high altitude path of the projectile. With no objections I'd like to bring it along with the next Missile Sub PR.

Turnspeed reduction (2 from 3) addressing targeting behavior vs idling YAKs/MiGs. The unit dances a bit when trying to face these particular targets in-between shots. Issue mostly visual. This is the case regardless of what AA projectile is assigned to the unit. Although YAKs/MiGs are poor targets for the SubMissileAA it still ought to look decent since players will do this anyway from time to time.

If possible, a solution would be for trait like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#attackfrontal to allow the SubMissileAA weapon to fire from ca. 20-30 degrees off it's front facing the target, and retain the normal SubMissiles requirement of having the unit directly facing the target. As per discussion with @chrisforbes  this is something that might require a bit of extra code work. This is a fix beyond my reach so I'm currently submitting this PR as-is with the (less than satisfactory) turnspeed reduction.

data.title: [TS/RA2] Some Ideas about bridges...
data.body:
- Low Bridges could be reduce the speed of a unit. (Low: 75% / 100% or High: 90% / 100%)
- The Unit weight could be affecting the health of bridges and damage them.
- The Amount of using a Bridge could initiate a "Tired material" effect.

This would effect the Gameplay:
- A Unit can damage Bridges ( By moving over them, or by its weight)
- Players / AI has to repair a Bridge when they gots damaged
- 100 Units cant use the Bridges at the same time :)
- Non-repairable bridges are broken forever...
- Unit Speed changes on type of damage states and bridge types

data.title: Tweak aircraft resupply behaviour.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This implements two changes to hopefully wrap up our aircraft resupply ordeal (for this release cycle, at least):
1.  When the "return to base" hotkey is used all aircraft will return to base, but only those that can be resupplied will land on helipads.  This avoids the annoying dance (particularly in TD, where helipads are only used for repairing) where loaded/repaired helicopters will touch-and-go on the pad, wasting time that could be used resupplying those that actually need it.
2.  @e1d1s1 has been arguing (#11979, #11982) that aircraft continuing their attacks after resupplying is a gameplay regression, and i'm now inclined to agree.  This adds an `AbortOnResupply` flag to disable this feature, and enables it by default.

data.title: Negating the minimum value of a twos complement number is invalid.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Version: playtest-20160904

Hello all, I keep crashing with this error and have some information about it.

Exception of type `System.OverflowException`: Negating the minimum value of a twos complement number is invalid.

I have seen something about this error before but can only find a cached page on Google asking someone for a replay, 

I am seeing this error a lot and can produce multiple log file sets and replays if required.  We play large custom maps (normally 256x256) with modified rules to make games challenging and longer and work well on very large maps.  We spend much time working out how to make big MP maps run faster by carefully tweaking rules and map layout.  We archive all of our games' log files and replays by default and create our own maps.  We have a number of games producing this error which is becoming troublesome.

I think this problem is related specially to Allied AA guns firing.  It seems to connected to the instant a new gun is built and happens more regularly when the gun is near the edge of the map (and the target aircraft is off the map) although it can also happen when the gun is anywhere.

After looking at a number of exception call stacks, I am suspicious that before the turret is "fully built", some angle values between the turret and the target aircraft pass an invalid value to System.Math.AbsHelper() when calculating the inverse tangent between the 2 sets of coordinates to check whether the gun's yaw matches the target bearing.  In short, it seems to depend where the target aircraft when the gun is built.

I can't say that I am right about the AA gun theory, but there is some evidence of this.

This particular game was suffering poor performance patches due to the pathfinder not liking units on a long thin bridge, we were in the process of producing this on demand and ending it again by taking them out!  I don't think performance is linked to this crash, I just wanted to explain the timings in perf.log.

[Logs.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/491514/Logs.zip)

Keep up the good work.

James

data.title: Updated Mono to version 4.6.0
data.body: Compiles and runs fine in my tests. See http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/releases/4.6.0/ for a changelog.

data.title: [Installer] Allow an installed (en-US) TFD as Source
data.body:
This PR allows us to use an existing Installation of "The First Decade" from Harddisk Like: C:\Games\TFD\
Further PRs will enable to use existing Installations From Harddiscs:
- TS + Firestorm (1999) Release Discs (GD and Nod, Firestorm discs)
- RA2 + Yuri

For Reviewers: Steps:
- Install a clean US TFD (the normal way via the DVD-Installer (Setup.exe) )
- remove the DVD from the Drive and remove the OpenRA Content or rename the folders
- Let OpenRA try to install the wished MOD Content.
  -> OpenRA should find via registry the Content in the Location where you installed your TFD:
  "Ex: D:\Games\TFD-Instal\bla bla"

This PR allows us a way to install RA2 and YURI ...

data.title: TemporaryOwnerManager should reduce remaining time when damaged.
data.body:
From the d2k README.TXT:

```
    3.9 Deviators 

If a unit becomes deviated, control can be regained by firing at that unit. Each time the deviated 
unit is damaged the remaining time until the player regains control is reduced. This means it is 
best to attack it with weapons that fire rapidly but do little damage. Sonic tanks can be very 
effective against Deviators, but they need to be used in pairs.
```

This can be done by implementing `INotifyDamage` and decreasing the remaining counter by a value set in the trait info.  The "hard" part will be measuring the per-hit reduction used by the original game.

data.title: Use CosmeticRandom for picking smudge type.

This is a temporary workaround that fixes #12091 until we can rework these traits properly in (hopefully) Next+1 (see #12093).

See #12091 for the repro case.

data.title: Smudge and resource layers should be split into state and render traits
data.body:
These traits currently handle both the "true" state of the world as well as the player-specific (freezing under fog) views.  This makes for some rather ugly code, incorrect rendering when observers switch players, and a collection of other bugs and desyncs.

These should be split into:
- A world trait (`ResourceLayer` / `SmudgeLayer`) that manages the "true" state of the world.
- A player trait (`ResourceRenderer` / `SmudgeRenderer`) that manages the per-player visibility.

- [ ] Resources #13902
- [ ] Smudges

> Is it just me, or does at least nod07a only start producing actors from these facilities after they have been destroyed and rebuilt? The ProduceInfantry and ProduceVehicle functions are only called from BuildBuilding and themselves. The behaviour ingame seems to confirm this.

I can confirm this does appear to be the case.

data.title: OpenRA crashes on start. Mac El Capitan 10.11.6
data.body:
Tried with release-20160508 as well as playtest-20160904.
It gives error:

```
Operating System: OSX (Unix 15.6.0.0)
Runtime Version: Mono 4.6.0 (mono-4.6.0-branch/746756c Thu Sep  8 05:39:12 EDT 2016) CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: Could not load file or assembly '/Applications/OpenRA.app/Contents/Resources/OpenRA.Platforms.Null.dll' or one of its dependencies
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.Assembly:LoadFrom (string,bool)
  at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFrom (System.String assemblyFile, System.Security.Policy.Evidence securityEvidence) [0x00000] in /private/tmp/source-mono-4.6.0/bockbuild-xamarin/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-x86/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/Assembly.cs:551 
  at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile (System.String path, System.Security.Policy.Evidence securityEvidence) [0x00031] in /private/tmp/source-mono-4.6.0/bockbuild-xamarin/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-x86/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/Assembly.cs:588 
  at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile (System.String path) [0x00000] in /private/tmp/source-mono-4.6.0/bockbuild-xamarin/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-x86/mcs/class/corlib/System.Reflection/Assembly.cs:593 
  at OpenRA.Sound..ctor (System.String engineName) [0x00039] in <e6d176a851f24b5c8f6ead014bc49075>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00188] in <e6d176a851f24b5c8f6ead014bc49075>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00007] in <e6d176a851f24b5c8f6ead014bc49075>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0004f] in <e6d176a851f24b5c8f6ead014bc49075>:0
```

Also I've tried to remove settings.yml as suggested here: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11403
, however I have nothing but the logs dir in ~/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/

```
ls -la ~/Library/Application\ Support/OpenRA/
```

data.title: [TS] Allow Gate placing on walls (as like in originals)
data.body: In the vanilla TS it was able to place gates on walls which replaced the Wall sections which are covered by gates as like the component tower...

data.title: Add shadows to missiles/projectiles
data.body:
I recently learned of @pchote that this is already available in the code, and trying it out for myself with a simple map hack, litterally blew my mind:

![shadowb](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/18764023/fb76fab0-810f-11e6-81ad-eec00851885d.jpg)
The image's submissile shadows appear just a tad too dark given they're small and goes high above ground. Also some weak shadows for contrails/smoke would be a really nice touch.

Submissiles , V2 rockets, Artillery fire, MiG/Longbow missile, Cruiser fire, you name it, with added shadows, could be a major polish for all the mods.

data.title: Screenshots in d2k do not include the shroud.
data.body:
The other mods work fine, so I suspect that this is related to blend modes (d2k uses `Subtractive` for shroud  that makes this a renderer bug, not a d2k bug).  This occurs on both release-20160508 and current bleed.

![openra-2016-09-21t135520z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/18713812/88246728-800b-11e6-86ab-4bc7109f4b87.png)

data.title: Carryalls stay still on air after putting a unit back
data.body:
Noticable if Carryall has Plane characteristics as in my [modmaps](http://resource.openra.net/maps/16391/) instead of Helicopter. This doesn't happens after lifting a unit, but only putting it back.

There is a video that showing the problem: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e2WTRuwOFCc&feature=youtu.be
